alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Vance, Granville, north central Wake, eastern Durham and northwestern Franklin Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Franklinton, or 9 miles east of Creedmoor, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Henderson, Oxford, Creedmoor, Wake Forest, Butner, Franklinton, Kittrell, Rolesville and Youngsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Boaters on the open water and those camping outdoors are especially vulnerable to the dangers of lightning. Seek harbor immediately and find safe shelter in a nearby building or vehicle.
